dublin_core.dcvalue: We evaluated daily self monitored blood pressure BP data collected over one year using remote home monitoring Fifty treated moderately hypertensive subjects 26 males mean age 50 years 17 females mean age 54 years seven exclusions were recruited for the study in which semi automatic arm cuff BP measurement devices were used The daily self monitoring regimen had two phases of usage one of initial enthusiasm the first one to two months followed by a phase of lower usage 89 versus 64 PUnder0 01 Monitoring was missed more often P Under 0 01 during weekends 7 3 instances per patient compared with workdays 5 0 Lack of motivation was not considered to be a major barrier Approximately half of the study population was willing to continue the trial at the end of the one year study The occurrence of extreme BP values dropped significantly after the initial study month P 0 02 In conclusion routine remote BP monitoring is capable of collecting consistent and accurate data with sufficient sensitivity to reveal trends
Daily usage and efficiency of remote home monitoring in hypertensive patients over a one-year period.
